intro: Helosciadium heterophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helosciadium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Helosciadium heterophyllum is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
